reviews.text:
An incredibly informative museum. Go and learn about his life, not just the war with the U.S. but everything before as well. Don’t expect the history to be spoon fed to you. There is plenty to read in English. If you are really interested in knowing, prepare to take your time to browse the kiosks at every exhibit. The small entrance fee is well worth it. 

As a side note, food and refreshments, convenient (WC) restrooms, and places to rest are abundant in the vicinity.

An incredible museum, leading me to tears on a few occasions. This is a must visit. Be sure to ask for a guide, the employees are very knowledge, and can guide you through the museum's narrative. I will never forget my conversations with the museum's staff, and the horrific struggles of their countries people. The star of the show may well be Ho Chi Min, and for good reasons, but the level of injustice will become apparent after you have toured this building.

I actually like this museum very much. It is a very well stuctured museum and you can learn a lot from it. It is quite small and can take your time to see everything. They close the door 10 minutes before the closing time and will rush you to be out by the closing time. (They literally stand behind you and tell you to walk faster towards the exit)
Not a bad museum if you want to know about Ho Chi Minh in detail. Entry fee is 40k but what I liked was the air conditioning after I walked around the mausoleum and near by attractions.

The Mesuem is in the complex of the Presidential Palace and we walked to it after seeing the One pillar pagoda, also in the same vicinity. 
There were some souvenir shops selling trinkets, knick knack and fridge magnets. Some are selling shawls and t-shirts. 
I had a good walk here.

Interesting, a massive soviet vibe building in the heart of the city. No AC available if you want to escape the heat, but shades are making the walking around easier. While you can't enter any of the rooms, you have a great view into them and you can have a look from a many different angles. There are small information boards on the walls for almost every room. The basement kitchen is the only room you can actually walk into. The helicopter is still on the rooftop and the famous Mercedes in the basement. Interesting, but not very enlightening piece of history. For the cheap price I still recommend to have a look around here.

Closing hour is at 5pm but last entrance is at 4pm so be sure to be there early enough if not you won't be able to gain entry. There are also 2 types of tickets, one gains you entry into the palace and the other gains you access to both the palace and the exhibits on display. 

We were there pretty late (reached around 4) so by the time we got to some areas of the exhibits they were already closed and so we couldn't access them. 

The placards around are helpful descriptions. Place is rather large so if you really want to at least tour the palace properly (without considering the exhibits) it might be prudent to allocate about 1.5 hours to 2 hours, depending on your walking speed as the compound is rather large.

Amazing place. 90+ rooms, all furnished like they were the last days that the palace was used. Lots of stairs, if you can't do stairs there is a small elevator. There is no air conditioning so if the heat bothers you go early in the day. There are also wheelchair ramps for the outside steps, you will probably need help getting up though because they are steep.

Very big and beautiful palace with huge green lawn and big fountain. If you are doing a city tour in Ho Chi Minh city this is a must visit place. The palace has a number of big rooms which are historically very important. You can see huge conference rooms, huge dining rooms, rooms for diplomatic meetings, the bed rooms and many more. There is also a old helicopter at the terrace.

Amazing place. This is the place where the Vietnam War "ended". I spent several hours here just walking the hallways! It has five levels. It has a bunker downstairs with shooting range, War room! There are also equipment that had been used in the war, Radios and stuff like that. There's also presidential suite upstairs where you get to actually step into and see where the president was working. This place is so full of history and it's awesome. DO NOT MISS OUT THIS ONE! :) :) Definitely one of the best places to visit in Ho Chi Minh City!

We had a brilliant evening at the Opera House.  Ensure you arrive early to enjoy a glass of wine on the balcony before the show (left-hand side as you enter the building).

The show was really good, we all thoroughly enjoyed it.  The performers all came out into the foyer afterwards to allow the audience to take photos with them.
The theatre was really good. We came to see Teh Dar. An excellent show. Theatre itself could have done with a little more love and attention.

Superb show great example of contemporary dance and expression. The energy from the performer's just pulsates from the stage. They are a great example of Vietnamese culture. Do leave early the traffic around the theatre is tough.
Great acoustics and shows. The seating arrangement is great and almost all seats get a good view of the stage.

You must see this show in Opera House which is Saigon’s cultural and architectural icon built in 1898. It shows exotic Vietnamese tribe culture. Reservation needed in advance. Need to be checked the show schedule. Ticket prices are 700,000/1.150,000/1,600,000 VND in zone.

The most peaceful place I've ever been to. Nice and friendly people with lovely architecture. The view there is also awesome! Absolutely come back again!
Highly recommend :)
Nice and calm place for shalat. Even though the building looks old, but it is clean and well maintained
Quiet and clean mosque, with friendly jamaah.
Funny place for a mosque. Nice surprise
I am very happy I come Vietnam and I see Muslim mosque and I pry here
Ok
Beautiful place
ok
Good
OK

This is a very awesome place of worship. Close to other very popular Temples but this one which honours the sea goddess similar to Chinese Mazu is very old and a visual masterpiece. If you only visit one temple this should be on the list.

You can call “The Shrine of Miss Thiện Hậu” it more like a shrine than a pagoda. This place have been 259 years old (1760). Meaning that it was exist before the ”war world I” even before “America Civil war”. I could said that this is the oldest thing that still exist in Ho Chi Minh City (aka Sai Gon). 
Although this one have been repair and for many time. But the concept and the feeling of the old and vintage is still there.
It was giving the order by the French (when Việt Nam is still the colony of France) about not making any harm (vandal, tear down the place) in any circumstances when it reach a 100 year old.
First time I been here. I was stand in the perfect spot that I can see the separate line between the sun light and the shadow, which is the best experience I have ever had about this place(one of the picture below shown that). It not that good because it was took on the Iphone 6. But if you notice you find out too. 
Bottom line: If you a foreigner, or Vietnamese. Definitely drop by this place. Cause how many of us have a chance to go to the place have 250 years old, right ? As foreigner ! Make sure to have some one who understand about the place (tour guide, if you don’t have ! Rent one, it cheap) so you won’t find yourself get bored after 5 minutes there.
A very beautiful temple have been coming here for the last ten years. A very peaceful and mindful place...
I love Vietnam. This was my first stop. Wasn't disappointed in anyway.
Beautiful Taoist temple with very few tourists. Ceilings are adorned with circular incense sticks.
Food was decent and the prices were very reasonable. There's plenty of choices from one end of the street to the next end. A must visit when you come to Chumphon.
So fun ! Got the deepfried bread with coconut frosting
Night market not big but definetelly worth visiting
Small nigh street shopping.
Nice attraction for tourist that visit Chumphon. The mango rice and the thai pastry shop next to it is a must try and you can find all sorts of delicious desserts along the night bazaar.
It was really good. better than Colorado springs McDonald's.. Everything was fresh thank you

The coke machine is always broken, service is crapy, and the wait is not worth the food. You could go somewhere for better food and get it faster. If you are in a rush go somewhere else, this place is not worth it. To top it all off it is not kid friendly anymore. They have electronic devices that don’t even work half the time. I went once and a baby got run over by a high chair. NOT kid friendly at all.
My weakness! Always a crowd but worth the wait. This location one of the cleanest for being so busy.
Wow looks really nice, so modern, good customer service and they have some good deals.

Nasty food..filthy restaurant .. I am so fed up with the sorry excuse for customer service. I came in today and ordered chicken nuggets, no dipping sauce but 2 packs of mayo, they charged me for the mayo, then tried to give me someone elses food. after they handed my food to the car in front of me, they gave me the same food without replacing it. This place is a horrible location. I will never go back to this location. The sad thing is the owners could care less.

I go into Burger King on Wednesday because I meet up with a friend. We are at least in Burger King 3 times a month we usually have ice tea. But once in awhile will have something to eat. It's always clean and so are the bathrooms. Which I have to say I love the up-to-date look in Burger King. I especially like the way they designed the bathrooms. I like knowing I have privacy when I go into the bathroom.  Its become our favorite spot to catch up.
I really love their whoppers and their fries. I ordered a 10 piece chicken nuggets for a reasonable price. Always love Burger King anywhere I go and definitely recommend this place.
Usually really fast service, except during lunch hour. Great customer service as well
Had a bacon csburger, the hamburger was the size of a 50ct. Coin with 1 slice of bacon, the top of the bun was bigger than the meal.. very small hamburger, never again. Half star for the French fries
Very Clean and great service.  Awesome people. I felt welcomed.
Good place vew. Good Coffee, capuchino and Americano ... 😂
My vegetable noodle soup was huge and delicious and great value for 45k.
Piping hot delicious food really cheap couldn’t be better :)
Enormous portions, good value for money, tasty food and cheaper than competitors on the same street.
Taste is good , ambience is wonderful, they have this wonderful water body on glass. Overall a bit pricey but WYPIWYG - what you pay is what you get

Made famous by Anthony Bourdain, my husband and I wanted to come check out the Lunch Lady to see what the buzz was about. Unfortunately, as many reviewers have noted, things likely have changed after it became famous. It is a complete tourist trap. When you sit down, they immediately give you dishes that you have not ordered- fried and fresh spring rolls and shrimp pancakes. We said no to the fresh spring rolls but ate the other two. Both underwhelming for the price of 50K each. The bowl of Bun Bo Hue was fairly tasty (also 50K each), but the unethical business tactics definitely left a sour taste in our mouths. The table of two next to us had paid 500K for all three side dishes and 2 cook books (each book costs 80K on the sign). Comparable soups at other food stalls are as tasty (if not tastier) and much cheaper. Come by and take a picture but skip it.

An amazing meal! A bit more expensive but all worth it. We came here on Monday and had the best Thai Noodle Soup ever! It comes with lots of side dishes and various sauces. Loved it and would like to try every single dish on the menu.

It is pretty nice place to enjoy Vietnamese street food.
They are serving different menu per everyday.
The food is tasty and the price is reasonable.
The owner, Ms. Thanh is selling cooking book and it is easy to understand how to make it. The book is written by English & Vietnamese languages together.
This restaurant is a street restaurant but  you can find lots of different things.
The owner is very proud of her dishes.
Highly recommend.

Overrated. I should have read the reviews before coming to this place but I trusted my guidebook and Bourdain’s visit to this place, thinking that it should be alright. Not at all. Over paid for two terrible bowls of soup, very mediocre egg rolls and terrible spring rolls at 200k. 

If the food was great, I could overlook the price and say, “Oh it’s a tourist trap thing, but at least the food is good.” The food was not. At all.

The moment we sat down, plates of other dishes were placed on our table. Fried shrimp something, egg rolls, and spring rolls. The soup we received that day was savoury and artificially sweet tasting, and the meats in the soup was bland and tasteless. Spring rolls were dry and bland. Egg rolls were very fishy, and you could find similar elsewhere for cheaper. 

Overall I ended up barely eating my food and searching elsewhere for something better. I’m also upset because we were first quoted 240k, and when I asked again in shock how much each dish cost, he brought the price down to 200k. 

DO NOT GO HERE. There are way better places for delicious food. Also, delicious food that’s cheaper than this overpriced trap.

Finally lunch at the The Lunch Lady

This roadside restaurant open only for 4hours. 11-3pm. We arrived at 2.15pm and we were the last customer to get served. She has very limited food. And the food was delicious. 

I liked her recipe and bought the recipe book 📚 🙂
Great place for sate style beef ball noodle soup. My personal preference . Any other soups you can find better elsewhere.
Famous beef noodles by Chinese style.

Really good taste.
Sa te similar to the Japanese “tantanmen”.
Foreigner price for 70,000VND
Delicious broth! Clear, pure and tasty. Awesome.
Good foods but prices are not given....

Finally find what I want, a delicious Pho Bo: big portions, many greens, tasty broth, quality beef - 74,000 đ. the only thing that did not like is unpleasant service, but it is not a problem, it is possible to take food out.

There are no limits for improvement,

Delicious

Pretty reasonable price with very tasty soup and pho. Meatball and beef are both good. Open 24 hr and it’s a great place for late night supper or morning breakfast. Lots of foreigners and English menu is available.

Went with a friend and we had two different dishes. Both were exceptional. The best Pho I’ve had so far. Quick service. Reasonable price. English menu provided. We took a seat outside on the mini stools for the atmosphere but that may not be for everyone - it’s on the corner of a busy junction. There are seats inside. We were there around 1800 and were seated immediately

The service was more than rude from the moment we arrived until we were forced to leave. My partner had finished his pho and I was still enjoying mine when all of a sudden all three waiters were standing around us waiting for us to pay. While I was searching for the right amount one of the waiters threw the trash that was on the table in my pho and collected the dishes. When I asked for some explanation they just said that they thought we were finished and other people were waiting to be seated. No one apologized. As it is not one of the cheapest places either I felt cheated and cannot recommend anyone to visit that place.

The things that really stands out is the soup. You will amazed by how delicious the soup are. Although the price is a bit pricey, it's one hella delicious food. Would come again if I'm here as a tourist, but as a backpacker... Definitely choose pho in the street

The food here was tasty and the portion was big. I can easily say they don't sting on their beef slices because there were so many inside. The noodle was really yummy but it's own and we didn't need to add any chill or mint leaf. The soup had the just nice flavour for you to want to finish it all up. Only thing I didn't fancy was me and my friends had to wait almost 45 minutes to get a place. Besides that I'll surely come again to this place when visiting Vietnam

I enjoyed my lunch here.  Food was delicious.  Casual atmosphere.  Very busy when we visited, but fast service and tasty food in large portions for affordable prices.  Pho 2000 was recommended to us, and we were not disappointed.

The restaurant was famous for having President Clinton eat there. Not a big deal to me ;-)

The Pho was good, nothing special. I had better in Canada, much better in fact. The shrimp roll was a little better. I think this place has passed it prime.

Pho is ok here to compare with other Pho that i have been to before. Chicken rice , curry are good here. The restaurant is sometimes very crowded because guides recommend this place. 

This is where US president Bill Clinton came here in 2000 and he had Pho here with his daughter.
Good enough. Big portions. 6000vnd added to our bill in hand writing, apparently for napkins?! We didn't pay it and put the napkins back. Coffee downstairs is good though.

To be honest food is delicious dan great value for money. We really enjoy their beef and dried noodles though. On my first visited it is awesome experience but this time seems like they didn’t maintenance their place really well. Floor was very dirty seems like never swept and flies everywhere. If outside was like this I was wondering how’s about in the back. I recommend this place to my bf but when we were there he said “you will get sick when you eat on dirty place like this”. I hope the owner can maintain restaurant better so customer would be happy to come back because food is really delicious just poorly maintained.

Trang is honestly the best value for money Vietnamese restaurant in Brisbane. I have eaten there over 10 times and the food is always incredible, especially considering the reasonable pricing. Staff are always so friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend the Laksa.

My favorite Viet restaurant in town!! Love all of their menu. I have probably been there 1 - 2 times a month for last 8 years. Whatever I chose from their menu, I was always satisfied. Friendly staffs and fast serving as well.
Great selection. Strangely the take away has been more impressive than eating in. Kinda conflicted but the food is nice.
Place is usually really good, today I waited 40 min for crispy chicken. To get a soggy cold piece of chicken. Very disappointed.

One of the most creative restaurants in Saigon. 

The homemade ravioli with a side of sautéed potatoes is the best. They usually make the ravioli in the mornings at the back of the restaurant. 

There are two of three different menus floating around that are slightly different to each other. You can play roulette with some of the items. "Peter" Breakfast and "England" Breakfast are both unique. But you can only really find out what they are if you order them.

Good range of room types, from about 12 dollars for a room with no window and stair access, to around 40 dollars for a large family suite woth kift access . There are actually two hotels run by the same people. Bi Saigon and Bee Saigon. The Bi has an elevator/lift and costs slightly more, the Bee has stairs and is cheaper. The restaurant has quite good food and the menu is very very extensive oh, and the staff is very helpful and friendly. I may be a little biased as I stay there every time I go to Saigon and I even stayed there when I was 10 years old and visited with my family in the year 2000 the woman that owns the hotel recognized me.
We spend 2 very pleasant weeks there. Quiet but central location. Room price and comfort at the appripriate rate. Very friedly and ready to help hotel staff. Any time again.
Quiet. Ancient China style. Cozy. Friendly people.
Terrible staff. Absolutely unprofessional waiter in restaurant. Arrogant, unhelpful, antipathyc and bad. I never meet before with so bad staff.
Great place!!! Recommended
Excellent vegetarian food at really great prices! Arrive was fine. The place was PACKED with locals at lunchtime, which is always a good sign. The seaweed tofu soup was particularly enjoyable.

Sooo many options. Everything is vegetarian, and most is also vegan. Some staff members know English, but some know nothing. Point and choose. They have wifi (password on the table). They also have beer, but it's not listed under beverage so you have to ask for it.
Good place for vegetarian, food is good, staff is good
Nice place & comfortable. Menu with many choices, affordable and taste good. Nice staff

I regret that why I didn't find it before even I am living nearby from one year. Luckily I was searching for restaurant to have dinner, and I saw this. As ex vegetarian, I felt so good after seeing it.
After going inside, I saw so many Vietnamese people coming to eat vegetarian food. And I was thinking before that Vietnamese don't like anything without meat.
You will hardly find any place to seat during peak hours. So I will not recommend it for date or romantic dinner :D.
 Anyway food was awesome and very reasonable. Surprised by quick service though they have so much crowd. Nothing wrong items are served, no wrong bills are charged (which happens usually in crowded places). And so many varieties of vegetarian dishes are available. I would love to visit again and again.
Ok
Ngon k kém!
Tiếp khách, đồ ăn lên nhanh và đa dạng
Được
Quán ổn, thức ăn ngon, giá cả hợp lý, nhân viên phục vụ khá sexy

Extremely good Thai food at reasonable prices. 

The chrispy duck salad with cashew nuts is a must. The curries and duck are the specialty of the restaurant.
Amazing thai food!

전통있는 유명한 식당이다.
상도 받았던 것으로 기억한다.
음식의 양은 그리 많지 않다.
깔끔하게 음식이 나온다.
아쉽지만 가격은 조금 나간다. ^^
落ち着いて、タイ料理が楽しめます。数十年前から変わらない味が嬉しいですね。
雰囲気は良いですが、味は普通で値段高いです^^;

Food was very tasty! specially the garlic rice. I don't eat seafood, they have veg options as well. Their management made sure we get the food what we wanted.  It's not a cheap place. But its worth the money.

Easy website booking. Restaurant employee called you to confirm. No deposit required. On site security personnel will take care of your transportation. Quiet and cool room for meeting. Staff is respectful and responsive. Food is above average. Recommended for group.

Nice seafood lunch presented in a unique way.   Good service.  Tasty food.  We had a private room around the side of the restaurant.   You can also choose to sit in their open-air main dining area.   Recommend.
Long standing restaurant with cuisines from Europe to Asia. Airy and polite space. Appropriate to family, groups and friends
Food is average but very expensive. The room is so hot, aircons seem not working.

We were thrilled to find this restaurant and had a great lunch. Great outdoor seating. 

Rice pancake dish is a “thing” here and very well worth the experience. 

We found the service to be friendly and though sitting outside was a bit hot, we really enjoyed the experience.

A great place to eat local food of quality. The food is not expensive and the service is great. The waitress told me which dishes were gluten free so I didn't get sick. And I even had a dessert! Highly recommend if you visit Hanoi. I had Pho soup and some black beans soup dessert which were great!

It was great. So much choice didn't know where to start. Service was efficient. Food was excellent. Not a single dish was below Standard. Fantastic. Great value for money. Extremely tasty and satisfying!

Not a good place to look for authentic Vietnamese food. I came to dine with my parents and my niece. We ordered 2 pancakes, 8 fresh spring rolls (2 shrimp+pork & 6 pickled pig ear), 1 bowl of steamed snails, a sour beef salad and 2 bowls of chicken soup. The dipping sauce was very disappointing. My family came from Central Vietnam and never in our lives did we put mung beans and onions in our pancakes. The saving grace was the soup (my niece loved it) but I attribute this to the fact that you can never go wrong with a chicken soup recipe here in Vietnam. The bill wasn't at all expensive but I considered it not worth the mediocre food.
Very very popular amongst tourists and locals alike. Despite being so busy the service was good and the food excellent. Would recommend this place. You may need to share a table at busy times.
Amazing food!!

After a 10 day road trip around Egypt we spent our last day in Cairo at this hotel. It was bliss. They upgraded us to a suite, which was large, with two bathrooms and a great view. The room service breakfast was delicious and plentiful, and the bed was a pleasure to sleep in. The best part was the spa on the rooftop, with fresh scented aromatic candles burning along the entrance hallway; comfy plush bathrobes and slippers and a hot tub (one for men and one for women). Definitely have a hot drink and sweet at the lobby café. They make amazing chocolate creations, both to eat and to drink.

Staff is unbelievably kind, helpful and devoted. 

I visited most of the 5* hotels in this area (after 2 weeks of being in Cairo) and experienced their lobby, restaurants, pool etc and I can say without a doubt that the Kempinski is the one that gets a 10 on all checkmarks. 

Definitely is my go to hotel in Cairo for my next trips..thank you to the management for doing such a great job with the staff!

Its less than the average 5 Stars regarding the entrance, design and breakfast buffet. The team starting from the security reaching to the rooftop is very kind, helpful and welcoming. Regarding the prices i found it a little bit cheaper comparing to neighbour 5 stars hotels

Rooms are ok although sometimes they smell (smoke) breakfast is good! I originally gave three stars to the hotel but I just upgraded it to 4. Why? Because the staff answered to my comment and very politely promised that they will take better care of the rooms to avoid smoke smell. This is fantastic, well done!

Very enjoyable stay at this hotel, my wife and I booked four nights there and we were pleased with the service and the staff from the reception to the house keeping. 
The buffet is excellent and great variety of food, the service in the breakfast restaurant was excellent, and it is worth mentioning that we have not noticed any of the waiters pushing for tipping.

We come across minor problems with the shower,  one of the managers, a lady by the name of Aya, arranged a quick fix.

In general we were very pleased with the hotel and staff. 

Highly recommended.

Comfortably crowded place, unlike similar other heavily crowded restaurants. Food is good as well. They also have a lovely little roof top bar.

It's worth trying to see for yourself, if you like Japanese food.
Good taste in the cozy atmosphere and friendly professional staffs!! Highly recommend :)
Not as good as before but still great
Great food and excellent service.
Good food and decent decor

Remind everyone that the owner was caught driving while intoxicated last year, has not been charged. Murdered numerous poor people and damaged the lives of needy families. She has paid no compensation and had no punishment for her crimes yet as she is wealthy and can avoid it. You are supporting a consequences free life for the rich if you eat here.
Good food and service. Staff was very friendly and spoke understandable English. The pineapple was good.But the athmos feel was good there was some noise from the street.

Great food here. Expect to eat plenty. Various servings of meat carved directly onto your plate at the table. I have eaten here several times and have never been disappointed. Perfect place for groups. Meat is delicious, particularly the ham. My only small criticism is the building is getting a bit tired. Food and service is always quality. Recommend.

Best Brazilian restaurant in town. Went there with a few Brazilians pra matar a saudade da comida brasileira. It's not cheap but the quality is very good. They have great pão de queijo  (cheese bread)
Variety of BBQ meats ( beef, pork, chicken, lamb, prawn, sausage ) and vegetables are served continually. Way of serving is unique! Of course delicious! Only concern is serving speed is very quick.

Easily the nicest spot in Saigon to get away from the chaos. Beautiful views, beautiful dining and bar areas and an amazing ambiance. This place is special, bring someone you care about. Menu is inviting, I especially enjoyed the crab eggs Benedict.
Bring your loved ones, bring your parents, bring your best friends.

Expensive and stingy. Good view and vibes, perfect place to remind yourself how much richer you are than people living 50 meters away. We brought a group of 13. Big bill, no chips refills, they must be struggling financially despite their prices. Friendly but slow, disinterested waitstaff. I wish their management cared more, but as long as people are willing to pay 137k for a Jack Daniels on the rocks, the management will never need to care about customers. They will pour you water without asking, and charge you a quarter of your rent for what must be water from a Himalayan glacier. I am shocked we weren't charged for the air.

Lovely chairs tho

Too pricey for quality of food.  Service is mediocre.  They recently hired phillipino staff which is better than previous staff.  The positives is, it's by the water and The atmosphere is nice.  The service needs to improve especially hostess or front of house. They have no idea about customer service.

Great aspect right on the river with views back to district 1. Super fresh seafood prepared simply and left to shine, clever tasty but not overpowering sauces. Good range of beers including some local craft items, excellent cocktails, great range of spirits especially gins and all for less than the big hotels in District 1. Only down side was the speedboat transfer deal from town was a bit too pricey.
Amazing restaurant, very nice and helpful staffs. It may a little pricey but worth every penny. Suggested here. Average price about 60$ each person.

I was really worried about an Italian restaurant on Asia based on past experiences but this place blew me away.  The environment reminds me of several dining experiences in Italy.  The food and wine were great.  Nice oven for pizza and other snacks.  Worth the trip.
Excellent food and wide selection. Attentive service and well trained wait staff. Nice ambiance and a good place to relax. We Are repeat customers and do so happily.
Excellent pizza and beer. Just what we needed on a hot afternoon. Thank you for being open during Tet.
Went there for a dinner, it was my 3rd time and I always found good food
Good service but difficult to match aunthentic Italian taste
Delicious Italian food. Reasonable set lunch in D.1. Cozy ambience and professional service. Try their all kind of pasta and the mixed seafood.

From the moment my partner and I walked through the door we were greeted very well and shown to a table. The service was professional and prompt. The food was absolutely amazing! I will have dreams of the starter bread for months. The pasta was actually the beat pasta I have had in years, without a lie. I do very much recommend anyone that likes authentic Italian to eat here but make near the end of your trip. Only because if you eat here on your first night you will not want to eat anywhere else for the rest of your trip.

Been there numerous times. Has always been good. 
 Very disappointed on my Sunday visit.  Calamri as chewy as rubber.  Came with Mixed fried vegatable.  Barely a few calamari for the price tag. 

Everything else was good.
Great food, professional staff.. had a great pizza! It was like being in Italy ;)
Great for families. The pasta and minestrone soup was excellent. Service was very good too.
Great ambiance, efficient staff but the food was not what I expected. I ordered beef and it was over cooked and totally unedible. Very expensive the price I paid comparing to the quality of the food.
Great atmosphere and food, great service snd drinks

The food was great and nice atmosphere. We visit there for birthday dinner. And they helped us to make a surprise for our friend. U can reserve by phone call. But one thing i am a bit annoyed was they did a bit push me to buy drink. Moreover, the appetizer is much more than i expected. On the other hand, the main dish is much less than i expected. Haha
Chilling and lovely local place to have Vietnamese dinner. Nice.
Loved the place. Its my new lunchtime go to.

Ambient atmosphere with friendly bartenders. We had great crafted cocktails with sophisticated texture and had fun conversations together. Very glad to add on another cool place for hanging out with friends in the heart of Saigon. Highly recommend The Rex to surprise you and your mates.
Better than most Western restaurant. AND half price cocktails during happy hours 5pm to 8pm. Delicious food and drink. Perfect for romantic dinner for 2 or group hanging out.
A busy and bustling, usually. Nice view right on the river. Food is sort of "pub fare with flair".

This is definitely an excellent bar I would recommend in down town Ho Chi Minh city. I visited Ho Chi Minh city for business and I got to the bar after work. It was a good place for me to relax and have a drink alone. And the location is great too, it is very close to everywhere.

The staffs are very kind also very helpful to let you know what’s in the menu or help you if you need more information or recommendations.  The bartenders are making everyone comfortable in the bar :) and mostly important they are professional.

I went to the bar on Wednesday and it was chicken wings day, it got special prices for chicken wings. The chicken wings are very delicious here!  The beer is good too!

The bar is very clean, the music is excellent so that I could get relaxed in here. 

I will definitely miss the bar once I leave and will visit there again if I visit the city again.
Very good food & service, good cocktails

Enjoyed great Asian food. Fish curry was exceptional.. The owner was really awesome ..we eat there a few times  during our stay in ho chi mihn city..
..did not know they close at 3 pm.though ... on our return from Hanoi we decided to visit for a late lunch....Owner opened restaurant especially  for us .my husband .myself and our 3 children..we were really touched by this gesture...thank you..their overall service is really outstanding and place is really nice and cozy.
We were amazed with the quality of both the food and service here. The Chili crab is a must have and everything else that touched our lips was delightful.
Lovely place, decor great, good service, plenty of pretty young things dining here....food abysmal. Worst Char Kway Teow ever. Hardly any noodles. All food dark...using heavy soy?
One of the few late night restaurant in HCM. Cozy place & good polite service. Tasty food & friendly staff.

Dine here a couple of times over the last few years [and once at their Super Bowl branch (already closed)]. Although a little pricy, will continue to patronise once a while. Their frog porridge tasted very close to the very famous one in Geylang Singapore. Their other dishes are probably one of the best you can get outside of Singapore.

They have changed the name to Osman or something like that. Same location, different name. Fried rice & beef is delicious! Price is okay. Big potion too! Muslims travellers, if you hungry, this is the place for you.
Nice food.  Price acceptable

Muslim preffered place for find halal food.
A long nguyen anh ninh road. Its called melayu street by me. Mostly is malaysian people around.

The menu on the restaurant is many. Its melayu cuisine. 
Price for a la carte around 80-150 K vietnam dong  and 20-80 for the drinks.
Delicious grilled squid and fascinating experience of drinking egg coffee
Very good halal food with Malaysian taste here

Whenever I am visiting Eau Claire I always go here for a coffee. They do  sell one the best coffee in the town. They have a big seating place and its fairly busy during the morning/afternoon. The employees are friendly and nice. They sell sandwiches, soup, cookies and muffins. I just wished they had more variety of breakfast menu though. But beside that its a good place to chill.

Nice, comfortable atmosphere. I've only been in there a couple times now, today. I can make this a place to visit regularly in my sobriety. Gotta thank them for their hospitality, as I am a southern American American. Would highly recommend it to my friends.
Great local music venue with good coffee and food. Their pita sandwiches and soup are the best.

What a fun place. I stopped by for a coffee,  I decided to treat myself to something special. The girls at the counter were friendly and helpful. I had a peppermint mocha which was delicious. I will be back.
Best sandwiches ever! So delicious. Great quiche and is the only place I'll drink coffee besides Starbucks which is saying ALOT! I absolutely love this place.

Enjoyed great Asian food. Fish curry was exceptional.. The owner was really awesome ..we eat there a few times  during our stay in ho chi mihn city..
..did not know they close at 3 pm.though ... on our return from Hanoi we decided to visit for a late lunch....Owner opened restaurant especially  for us .my husband .myself and our 3 children..we were really touched by this gesture...thank you..their overall service is really outstanding and place is really nice and cozy.
We were amazed with the quality of both the food and service here. The Chili crab is a must have and everything else that touched our lips was delightful.
Lovely place, decor great, good service, plenty of pretty young things dining here....food abysmal. Worst Char Kway Teow ever. Hardly any noodles. All food dark...using heavy soy?
One of the few late night restaurant in HCM. Cozy place & good polite service. Tasty food & friendly staff.

Dine here a couple of times over the last few years [and once at their Super Bowl branch (already closed)]. Although a little pricy, will continue to patronise once a while. Their frog porridge tasted very close to the very famous one in Geylang Singapore. Their other dishes are probably one of the best you can get outside of Singapore.
Love this pub. Great music and reasonably priced drink. Brilliant atmosphere, especially at Christmas.
Nice old fashion pub, with good music and friends
Great Place for a Quiet pint, Lovely Guinness, Bartenders super Lovely and Nice
An amazing place to stay, the atmosphere and everything about this place is a definite place to go if traveling to Inverness, I would recommend this place first and foremost
Truly remarkable place that takes you back in time with a spectacular array of music.

One of the most creative restaurants in Saigon. 

The homemade ravioli with a side of sautéed potatoes is the best. They usually make the ravioli in the mornings at the back of the restaurant. 

There are two of three different menus floating around that are slightly different to each other. You can play roulette with some of the items. "Peter" Breakfast and "England" Breakfast are both unique. But you can only really find out what they are if you order them.

Good range of room types, from about 12 dollars for a room with no window and stair access, to around 40 dollars for a large family suite woth kift access . There are actually two hotels run by the same people. Bi Saigon and Bee Saigon. The Bi has an elevator/lift and costs slightly more, the Bee has stairs and is cheaper. The restaurant has quite good food and the menu is very very extensive oh, and the staff is very helpful and friendly. I may be a little biased as I stay there every time I go to Saigon and I even stayed there when I was 10 years old and visited with my family in the year 2000 the woman that owns the hotel recognized me.
We spend 2 very pleasant weeks there. Quiet but central location. Room price and comfort at the appripriate rate. Very friedly and ready to help hotel staff. Any time again.
Quiet. Ancient China style. Cozy. Friendly people.
Terrible staff. Absolutely unprofessional waiter in restaurant. Arrogant, unhelpful, antipathyc and bad. I never meet before with so bad staff.
